labels.desc10: Our clinics feature several specialties, providing our patients with a unique experience.
labels.ahramDesc: Stay informed and maintain your health
labels.blog32: Cleansing:* Use gentle cleansers suitable for your skin type and clean your skin regularly to remove dirt and excess oils.
labels.blog33: Moisturizing:* Apply a moisturizer that suits your skin type to keep it hydrated and prevent dryness.
labels.blog34: Sun Protection:* Use sunscreen daily to protect your skin from the effects of UV rays and aging.
labels.blog35: Deep Cleansing:* Include regular deep cleansing and exfoliation to maintain fresh and glowing skin.
labels.blog36: Healthy Nutrition:* Eat a balanced diet and drink enough water to improve your skin's health from the inside.
labels.blog38: Regular Washing:* Wash your hair regularly using shampoo and conditioner suitable for your hair type.
labels.blog39: Avoid Over-Styling:* Avoid frequent use of high-heat styling tools and opt for gentle styling methods.
labels.blog40: Good Nutrition:* Eat foods rich in vitamins and minerals to promote scalp health and hair growth.
labels.blog41: Minimize Pollution:* Protect your hair from pollution by wearing a hat or using hair protectants.
labels.blog42: Regular Trimming:* Trim your hair regularly to maintain healthy ends and remove split ends.
labels.blog43: By following a healthy lifestyle and regular care for your skin and hair, you can maintain a healthy and beautiful appearance for a long time.
labels.featuresDesc18: We provide comprehensive care for the diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic blood disorders using the latest medical technologies. Our team of hematologists works to deliver personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient’s needs.
labels.featuresDesc19: We specialize in diagnosing and treating diabetes and endocrine disorders to ensure a healthier and more balanced life. Our clinic offers innovative solutions and personalized treatment plans to efficiently manage diabetes and endocrine issues.
labels.featuresDesc20: We offer specialized diagnostic and therapeutic services for all types of allergies and immune deficiencies. Our goal is to enhance your quality of life through innovative treatment plans to control allergy symptoms and boost immunity.
labels.desc21: Preparing the pool: The water pool is filled with warm water (typically between 37-38°C) to cover the mother's abdomen and upper thighs.
labels.desc22: Monitoring the mother and baby: The condition of the mother and baby should be continuously monitored during the delivery process. Blood pressure, heart rate, and water temperature are measured regularly.
labels.desc23: Delivery in water: When active labor stages begin, the mother is allowed to engage in water to ease pain and facilitate delivery. She may sit, stand, or float during this period.
labels.desc24: Guiding the process: The midwife or doctor guides the mother through the water birth process, assisting in body positioning as necessary.
labels.desc25: Welcoming the baby: After delivery, the baby is carefully lifted from the water and placed on the mother's chest. It’s important to monitor the baby to ensure they are breathing and responding normally.
labels.desc27: A serious condition that occurs when blood sugar levels are extremely high (above 600 mg/dL) or extremely low (below 70 mg/dL), causing unconsciousness and loss of control over blood sugar levels.
labels.desc28: Immediate medical care: In case of suspected diabetic coma, call emergency services immediately or take the patient to the nearest medical center.
labels.desc29: Measuring blood sugar: If diabetic coma is suspected, measure the blood sugar level using a glucose meter.
labels.desc30: Providing sugary sources: If the coma is caused by low sugar levels, attempt to give the patient quick sugary sources like fruit juice, non-diet soda, or glucose tablets.
labels.desc32: Cleansing: Use gentle and suitable cleansers for your skin type, and clean your skin regularly to remove dirt and excess oils.
labels.desc33: Moisturizing: Use a moisturizer suitable for your skin type to keep it hydrated and avoid dryness.
labels.desc34: Sun protection: Apply sunscreen daily to protect your skin from UV rays and premature aging.
labels.desc35: Healthy nutrition: Eat a healthy and balanced diet with adequate water intake to enhance skin health from within.
labels.desc37: Regular washing: Wash your hair regularly using shampoo and conditioner suitable for your hair type.
labels.desc38: Avoid excessive styling: Limit frequent high-heat styling and use gentle styling tools.
labels.desc39: Good nutrition: Eat foods rich in vitamins and minerals to promote scalp health and hair growth.
labels.desc40: Reduce pollution: Protect your hair from pollution by wearing a hat or using hair protectants.
labels.desc41: Regular trimming: Trim your hair regularly to maintain healthy ends and prevent split ends.
labels.desc42: By adopting a healthy lifestyle and regular care, you can maintain a healthy and beautiful appearance for a long time.
labels.featuresDesc1: Maintaining oral health is essential not only for general well-being but also for better quality of life, as it affects the ability to eat comfortably.
labels.featuresDesc2: We focus on diseases and injuries affecting the nervous system, which impacts various body functions.
labels.featuresDesc3: A cardiac rehabilitation program to help restore physical activity and a healthy lifestyle after heart disease.
labels.featuresDesc4: Conducting routine exams such as cervical cancer screenings. Monitoring risks during pregnancy and childbirth and providing care during labor.
labels.featuresDesc5: Following up with patients after treatment to evaluate the effectiveness of therapy and health stability. Providing psychological and emotional support to patients and their families.
labels.featuresDesc6: Comprehensive care (psychological/physical/health/social) considering changes in the body and mind with aging.
labels.featuresDesc7: External appearance affects mental health, as improving appearance can boost self-confidence and happiness.
labels.featuresDesc8: Obesity increases the risk of heart disease, type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, certain cancers, and joint problems.
labels.featuresDesc9: Occurs when uric acid builds up in the body, leading to painful episodes of arthritis.
labels.featuresDesc10: We focus on reproductive and urinary system health, treating common conditions like bladder infections and bladder stones.
labels.featuresDesc11: Focuses on eye and vision health, addressing visual problems that may affect quality of life.
labels.featuresDesc12: Internal medicine doctors play a vital role in providing comprehensive healthcare by diagnosing and treating chronic and acute illnesses.
labels.featuresDesc13: Bone issues can significantly impact mobility, movement, and daily activity levels.
labels.featuresDesc14: Focuses on children's health from birth to adolescence. Pediatricians diagnose and treat illnesses while ensuring proper growth and development.
labels.featuresDesc15: Focuses on diagnosing and treating conditions related to the nose, ears, throat, and some areas of the head and neck.
labels.featuresDesc16: The skin, as the body's largest organ, plays a key role in protecting the body from external factors, reflecting overall health.
labels.featuresDesc17: Focuses on preventing, diagnosing, and treating men's health problems while promoting awareness of general health and its influencing factors.
labels.blogDesc1: In water birth, the mother gives birth while immersed in water, usually in an inflatable or fixed pool. She may also choose to labor in water but deliver outside it. This can be a good option if you want the benefits of hydrotherapy.
labels.blogDesc2: Diabetic coma is a life-threatening disorder causing unconsciousness. For people with diabetes, extreme high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) or extremely low blood sugar (hypoglycemia) can lead to diabetic coma.
labels.blogDesc3: Skin care involves a set of practices aimed at maintaining skin integrity, enhancing appearance, and improving overall health while reducing skin disorders and aging.
labels.blogDesc4: Hair care is a broad term for hygiene and beauty practices related to human scalp hair. It involves grooming, trimming, or shaving according to hair type and location, using different processes that can be applied to the hair. Hair diversity reflects human diversity.
labels.desc1: Clinics offering comprehensive medical services for all your healthcare needs.
labels.desc2: Our team includes elite doctors and specialists with diverse expertise and experience.
labels.desc3: Committed to delivering high-quality, comprehensive care to patients.
labels.desc4: Our mission is to improve your quality of life and elevate your health.
labels.why2: A qualified medical team with a selection of specialized, experienced doctors in all fields ensures safe, expert care for every patient.
labels.why3: Distinguished by offering all medical services under one roof.
labels.why4: We ensure patient comfort by providing a safe and relaxing environment.
labels.why6: Relies on a professional and specialized medical team.
labels.why7: We offer patients the convenience and ease of receiving comprehensive care without the need to move between multiple facilities.
labels.services7: Hemodialysis: Used for patients whose kidneys can no longer perform their normal functions. Dialysis is needed when the kidneys cannot filter toxins and waste from the blood sufficiently.
labels.services8: Helps diagnose certain diseases in a non-invasive way to evaluate available treatment options.
labels.services17: A quick measure of blood flow in vessels.
labels.services19: Uses movement therapy, manual therapy, and physical exercises to improve mobility, reduce pain, and restore function after injury or surgery (kinesiotherapy - rehabilitation therapy - pediatric physiotherapy - geriatric physiotherapy - etc.).
labels.services21: Tests performed on samples of blood, urine, or bodily fluids to diagnose diseases, assess health, or monitor treatment effectiveness.
labels.services33: Commonly used in medicine to visualize internal body structures.
labels.services26: An imaging technique using high-frequency sound waves to create images of organs and tissues.
labels.services27: Cardiac ultrasound imaging creates images of the heart and blood vessels.
labels.services28: A test that records the heart's electrical activity.
labels.services29: Monitors the heart's electrical activity over an extended period, usually 24 hours or more.
labels.services30: A visual representation showing the brain's structure and function with various types available.
labels.services31: A visual representation showing the structural and functional layout of nerves in the body.
labels.services32: Used to measure changes in frequencies caused by motion.
